title: 'Gazans begging us ... ': Netanyahu outlines 5 'principles' to end war; blasts 'campaign of lies'
content: Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu asserted that Israel's goal in Gaza is liberation from Hamas, not long-term occupation, outlining five principles for ending the war, including Hamas's disarmament and Israel's security control. He accused Hamas of being a genocidal organization and stated that Gazans desire freedom from their rule.

title: Kerala rerun? UK F-35 jet makes emergency landing in Japan; media has field day
content: A British F-35B stealth fighter jet made an emergency landing at Kagoshima Airport in Japan due to a malfunction, briefly disrupting commercial flights. This incident, part of a joint drill with Japan and the US, follows a similar event in India less than two months prior.

title: Another faceoff? India, Pak navies to hold drills at same time in Arabian Sea
content: The Indian Navy is set to conduct naval drills in the Arabian Sea, coinciding with Pakistan's naval exercises in its territorial waters. These drills follow a tense military standoff in May, during which India's armed forces executed coordinated strikes against Pakistani military assets, including aircraft and radar systems. A notable engagement involved an S-400 missile intercepting a Pakistani surveillance aircraft.

title: 'Irregularities in 2019 LS polls': Cong doubles down on 'vote chori' claim; to launch audit
content: Congress plans a comprehensive audit of the 2019 Lok Sabha voters' list, alleging irregularities. KC Venugopal highlighted that opposition parties lost in 48 constituencies by narrow margins. He claimed PM Modi's mandate wasn't genuine, citing Rahul Gandhi's allegations of electoral fraud.

title: BCCI breaks silence on Rohit Sharma and Virat Kohli’s ODI future
content: The BCCI is in no hurry to decide on Virat Kohli and Rohit Sharma's ODI future amidst speculation about their participation in the 2027 World Cup. With the Australia series in October being the next ODI commitment, their age is a talking point. While a farewell game was rumored, a BCCI source denied such discussions.

title: ‘People are going to walk in the door &…’: PwC AI assurance leader on junior hires
content: PwC is reshaping its training programs as AI transforms the accounting industry. Junior accountants will quickly assume manager-level responsibilities, overseeing AI systems that handle routine tasks. The firm is emphasizing fundamental audit principles, critical thinking, and advanced analytical skills for new hires to adapt to the evolving landscape.

title: 'Below standard': Kalyan Banerjee attacks Moitra again; regrets remarks on Mamata
content: Kalyan Banerjee, a Trinamool Congress MP, has sharply criticized fellow party leader Mahua Moitra, labeling her as "below standard" and a "wasteful lady," escalating the ongoing tensions within the party. This verbal attack follows a public clash between the two leaders over the South Kolkata Law College rape case.

title: 'Vote chori' claims: K'taka top poll officer sends notice to Rahul, seeks proof
content: The Election Commission has demanded evidence from Rahul Gandhi regarding his claims of voter fraud in Karnataka during the 2024 Lok Sabha elections. Gandhi alleged that over a lakh votes were stolen in Mahadevapura through duplicate entries and fake addresses. He urged the EC to release digital voter rolls for public audit.

title: FASTag Annual Pass to go live on August 15: Fee, validity, number of trips allowed & other details
content: India's FASTag system is getting an upgrade. The National Highways Authority of India will launch the FASTag Annual Pass on Independence Day. This pass costs Rs 3,000. It allows up to 200 toll crossings or a year of travel for private vehicles. The goal is to reduce congestion and speed up toll transactions.

title: 'There's some boss who ...': Rajnath mocks Trump's attempt to damage India's economy
content: Defence Minister Rajnath Singh criticized the US President's tariff hikes on Indian imports, suggesting that some global powers are attempting to hinder India's economic progress due to jealousy over its rapid growth. Despite these challenges, Singh asserted India's unstoppable rise as a major global power, highlighting the country's increasing defence exports as a sign of resilience and strength.

title: 'Largest surface-to-air kill': IAF chief on how S-400 was game-changer in India-Pak face-off
content: Air Chief Marshal A P Singh revealed that during Operation Sindoor, India achieved its largest surface-to-air kill by downing a Pakistani aircraft at 300km, crediting the S-400 system. The IAF also confirmed five kills of Pakistani fighters through electronic means. India targeted Pakistani airbases and infrastructure, including hangars and radar sites, causing significant damage and operational disruptions.

title: Watch: Couple perform stunts on car roof in Pune; video goes viral
content: A couple in Pune was filmed performing dangerous stunts on the roof of a moving car in Kharadi, engaging in romantic poses amidst traffic. This incident follows another recent video from Shindewadi, where a woman was seen riding backwards on a motorcycle's petrol tank. Such acts violate Section 184 of the Motor Vehicles Act, risking fines and imprisonment.

title: Nvidia CEO checks salaries of company's 42,000 employees; says: It's a strategy that…
content: Nvidia CEO Jensen Huang personally reviews the compensation of all 42,000 employees monthly, utilizing machine learning to optimize the process. He dismisses rumors of secret stock options, emphasizing generous compensation for all workers. Huang believes in prioritizing employee well-being, which he feels drives overall success. This strategy has significantly benefited Nvidia's leadership, creating billionaires within his management team.

title: ‘Zero defect, zero effect’: PM Modi pushes for 'Tech Atmanirbhar Bharat’
content: Prime Minister Modi championed 'zero defect, zero effect' manufacturing in Bengaluru, urging youth to spearhead 'Make in India' and 'Atmanirbhar Bharat'. He highlighted India's economic rise to the top five globally, emphasizing technology self-reliance. Modi inaugurated metro lines, flagged off Vande Bharat trains, and praised indigenous defense technology.

title: 'Guaranteed win through EVMs': Raut echoes '160 seats' claim; 'men approached Uddhav twice'
content: Sanjay Raut alleged that individuals approached Uddhav Thackeray, offering victory in tricky seats via EVMs, similar to an approach made to Sharad Pawar. These individuals claimed the ruling party had a plan to win through EVMs and electoral rolls.

title: Vote-chori row: BJP attacks Rahul for 'baseless' claims; calls him 'perpetual youth' of politics
content: BJP's Sudhanshu Trivedi has strongly criticized Rahul Gandhi for his accusations against the Election Commission, dismissing them as baseless and stemming from frustration over Congress's loss of power. Trivedi refuted Gandhi's claims regarding voter exclusion in Bihar and fraudulent voters in Bengaluru, challenging him to provide evidence and questioning the INDIA bloc's inaction on the matter.

title: Tyreek Hill, ex Keeta Vaccaro rush baby Capri to ER; now recovering
content: Tyreek Hill's eight-month-old daughter, Capri, was rushed to the emergency room after developing alarming symptoms, causing significant concern for her mother, Keeta Vaccaro. Doctors swiftly stabilized Capri, and her condition improved by sunrise. Despite ongoing family turmoil, the outpouring of support from fans highlights the shared relief and gratitude for Capri's recovery.

title: Taylor Swift on going public with Travis Kelce: 'Proud of each other'
content: Taylor Swift openly embraced her relationship with Travis Kelce, contrasting sharply with her past privacy, particularly with Joe Alwyn. Swift explained to TIME that they proudly support each other, dismissing the need to hide their romance. Since 2023, they've been publicly affectionate, attending events and date nights, fueling engagement speculations.

title: Magic Johnson, wife Cookie share heartfelt moment for his mother’s memory
content: Magic Johnson celebrated his mother, Christine Johnson's, 90th birthday with a heartfelt party alongside his wife, Cookie, and their children. The event, filled with love and appreciation, honored Christine's life dedicated to the Lord. Gospel artist Tamela Mann surprised Christine with a performance, making the celebration even more special at Breslin Arena.

title: Top Chinese diplomat detained: Was in line for foreign minister role - reports
content: Senior Chinese diplomat Liu Jianchao, a potential future foreign minister, has been detained for questioning, raising concerns within the Communist Party. Liu, who heads the international department, was reportedly taken into custody after returning from an overseas trip. The reasons for his detention remain unclear, marking a high-level inquiry since the removal of former foreign minister Qin Gang.

title: Kylie Kelce’s heartfelt gesture becomes most talked-about moment of NFL weekend
content: Kylie Kelce, married to NFL star Jason Kelce, is carving her own path through advocacy and media. She champions body confidence with Dove's initiative and hosts the "Not Gonna Lie" podcast, amplifying diverse voices. Her work extends to producing films like "Fans of Confidence," promoting resilience and representation, proving her influence transcends the football field.

title: Evander Kane celebrates Leon Draisaitl and Celeste Desjardins’ wedding in style
content: Evander Kane, former Oilers forward, attended Leon Draisaitl and Celeste Desjardins' wedding in France, sharing photos on Instagram with a heartfelt message. Accompanied by fiancée Mara Teigen, Kane joined other NHL stars like Connor Brown and Ryan Nugent-Hopkins at the lavish event. Lauren Kyle, Connor McDavid's wife, was a bridesmaid.

title: Leylah Fernandez shares surprising dating news ahead of Cincinnati Open
content: Leylah Fernandez, fresh off her Washington victory, revealed she went on her first-ever date after a fan's message caught her eye in Montreal. Following careful vetting with her family's help, she met the fan, even going on a second date. Despite a loss at the Canadian Open, Fernandez feels balanced and ready for the Cincinnati Masters, balancing romance and tennis.

title: Bihar polls: JD(U) workers urge Nitish's son to contest; erect posters
content: Janata Dal (United) workers have put up posters in Patna, urging Chief Minister Nitish Kumar's son, Nishant Kumar, to contest the upcoming Bihar assembly elections. Nishant is scheduled to address a public meeting, fueling speculation about his formal entry into politics.

title: Gaza takeover plan: IDF preps for 'theatres of war'; launches surprise military drill
content: The IDF initiated a surprise military exercise, "Dawn," to assess readiness amid plans to expand its Gaza campaign, a move approved by Netanyahu's cabinet despite domestic and international criticism. This decision follows strikes on Hezbollah operatives and precedes a press conference by Netanyahu addressing the expanded Gaza operation.

title: As India prepare to announce Asia Cup squad, Ex-cricketer: 'We obsess too much over ...'
content: As India gears up to announce its squad for the upcoming Asia Cup in the UAE, former cricketer Priyank Panchal shares his insights on team selection, emphasising the importance of flexible batting positions. The tournament, featuring eight teams in a T20I format for the first time, will see India face UAE, Pakistan, and Oman in Group A.

title: No relief in sight: 4-day orange alert in flood-ravaged Himachal; toll reaches 219
content: Himachal Pradesh is grappling with severe monsoon rains, resulting in 219 deaths and significant infrastructure damage estimated at Rs 1,988 crore since June 20. An orange warning has been issued for the next four days, anticipating further heavy rainfall and potential disruptions. Authorities are urging residents to stay vigilant, especially in vulnerable areas, as restoration efforts continue amidst unprecedented damage.

title: 19-year-old Rajasthan Royals pacer creates history, becomes first ever to...
content: Kwena Maphaka, a 19-year-old South African bowler, delivered a remarkable performance against Australia, claiming 4 for 20. His impressive spell, the best by a South African against Australia in T20Is, helped restrict the opposition. Despite Tim David's resilient 83, Maphaka's early breakthroughs ensured Australia never fully recovered, showcasing his potential as a future star.

title: UP horror: Woman chops off husband’s genitals after quarrel in Amethi; held
content: In Fasanganj Kachnaw village, a domestic dispute escalated when Nazneen Bano allegedly attacked her husband, Ansar Ahmad, with a knife, severing his genitals during a heated argument. Ahmad, who had two wives and no children, was rushed to AIIMS Raebareli for treatment. Police have taken Nazneen into custody for interrogation following the violent incident.

title: India's giant space leap: After NISAR mission, Isro to launch 6,500-kg US satellite
content: ISRO is set to launch a 6,500 kg US-built communication satellite from Indian soil, marking a significant milestone. This follows the successful launch of the NASA-ISRO NISAR mission on July 30. ISRO Chairman V Narayanan highlighted this achievement, recalling India's humble beginnings in space with a donated rocket from the US.

title: Spectator takes incredible one-handed catch as David smashes Bosch for 6 - Watch
content: During the Australia vs South Africa T20I, a spectator made an incredible one-handed catch while holding two drinks, stealing the show. Tim David's explosive 83 rescued Australia from a collapse, but they were eventually bowled out for 178. Despite Australia's innings consisting of bold hitting and untimely dismissals, the fan's amazing grab became the standout moment.

title: 'Why now?' In Op Sindoor revelations, Cong sees bid to divert from 'vote theft' row
content: Congress leaders are questioning the timing of Air Chief Marshal AP Singh's disclosure about Pakistan's losses during Operation Sindoor. Udit Raj linked the revelation to the ongoing “vote theft” controversy, while Imran Masood suggested it's a tactic to divert attention from allegations against the Election Commission.

title: SIR row: Tejashwi claims Bihar deputy CM has 2 EPIC numbers; his 'jungle raj prince' retort
content: Tejashwi Yadav accused Bihar's Deputy CM Vijay Kumar Sinha of voter fraud, claiming Sinha is registered in two constituencies with different ages and EPIC numbers. Yadav questioned the Election Commission's role, alleging possible forged signatures and deliberate facilitation of duplicate registrations for BJP supporters. The Election Commission refuted Yadav's claims, deeming the presented EPIC as fake and demanding its submission.

title: ‘India now top smartphone supplier to US’: Vaishnaw cites Rs 12L cr output
content: Union Minister Ashwini Vaishnaw announced India's rise as a leading smartphone supplier to the US, with electronics manufacturing reaching Rs 12 lakh crore. Electronic production has surged sixfold in 11 years, with exports increasing eightfold to Rs 3 lakh crore. India has become the second-largest mobile phone manufacturer globally, driven by a significant increase in domestic production.

title: 'Difficult to say': Ganguly stirs Kohli-Rohit speculation, backs India as favourites for Asia Cup
content: Sourav Ganguly addressed speculation surrounding Virat Kohli and Rohit Sharma's ODI futures, emphasizing performance-based selection. He highlighted their phenomenal white-ball records, advocating for their continuation if they maintain high performance levels. However, the former India skipper remained tight-lipped on the rumours that the upcoming three-match ODI series in Australia this October could be the final outing in the format for the celebrated duo.

title: VP election: INDIA bloc to field joint candidate; Kharge reaches out to allies
content: The INDIA bloc is set to field a joint candidate for the upcoming vice-presidential election, aiming to send a strong political message. Congress President Mallikarjun Kharge is engaging with allies to build consensus on potential nominees. This move follows a recent show of unity among opposition parties, including discussions on voter list manipulation led by Rahul Gandhi.

title: 'Limit to lying': Rijiju slams Rahul over Op Sindoor remarks, cites IAF chief rebuttal
content: Following Rahul Gandhi's allegations regarding Operation Sindoor, BJP leaders have strongly criticized the Congress MP for echoing a Pakistani narrative and undermining the armed forces. Kiren Rijiju and Amit Malviya shared IAF Chief AP Singh's remarks, emphasizing the government's clear political will and the freedom granted to the forces during the operation.

title: Kangana Ranaut reacts after Manisha Koirala hails her as ‘brilliant’ and ‘phenomenal’
content: Manisha Koirala recently lauded Kangana Ranaut as a "brilliant, phenomenal actor," alongside praising talents like Ranveer Singh and Alia Bhatt. Kangana responded with gratitude on her Instagram Stories, acknowledging Manisha's kind words with heartfelt emojis. This isn't the first time Manisha has admired Kangana, having previously praised her performance in 'Queen'.

title: Lion's share: India's big cats roar to record 891; 32% jump in five years
content: India's Asiatic lion population has seen a remarkable increase, surging by 32.2% from 674 in 2020 to 891 in 2025. This growth, highlighted in the 16th Lion Population Estimation report, includes expansion into new satellite areas and corridor regions. The rise in adult females by nearly 27% significantly boosts the species' reproductive capacity, marking a major success in conservation efforts.

title: Watch: PM Modi launches 3 Vande Bharat Express trains, Bengaluru Metro's yellow line
content: Prime Minister Narendra Modi inaugurated three Vande Bharat Express trains from Bengaluru, connecting Bengaluru to Belagavi, Amritsar to Sri Mata Vaishno Devi Katra, and Nagpur to Pune. He toured the Vande Bharat Express, interacting with schoolchildren. Additionally, PM Modi inaugurated Bangalore Metro's Yellow Line, expanding the city's metro network. He also laid the foundation stone for Bangalore Metro Phase 3.

title: Boy's 150km trek with severed arm exposes bonded labour, rescued in Haryana
content: A 15-year-old bonded labour survivor from Bihar is recovering in Haryana after a horrific ordeal. He was found walking along a road with a severed arm, narrating a tale of being lured with a job promise, then held captive at a dairy farm where he lost his arm in an accident.

title: 'Will obviously surpass MS Dhoni': Former India cricketer hails Rishabh Pant, claims England will soon build his statues
content: Aakash Chopra predicts Rishabh Pant will surpass MS Dhoni's Test run record if he maintains his form and gets to play regularly. Despite being currently sidelined, Pant has already scored 3427 runs in 47 Tests, including eight centuries, surpassing Dhoni's six. Chopra highlights Pant's exceptional performance in England, where he has amassed over 1000 runs, suggesting he could become India's greatest wicketkeeper-batter.

title: Ignored villagers’ warning: UP man heading home for Rakhi swept away
content: In a tragic incident in Bijnor, a 35-year-old man drowned after being swept away by strong currents on a flooded road. Neetu Singh, who had come from Haryana for Rakshabandhan, was returning from Sahaspur when he attempted to cross the waterlogged stretch near Jairampur village, ignoring warnings from locals.

title: 'My mistake': Rohit’s childhood coach shares how he discovered the batter inside him
content: Rohit Sharma's journey to becoming a destructive opener almost took a different turn. His childhood coach, Dinesh Lad, initially saw him as a promising off-spinner. Lad discovered Rohit's batting talent by chance when he saw him batting in school. Impressed by his skills, Lad promoted him to open, where he scored 140 runs.

title: Jaguars' Little nails would-be-record 70-yard FG
content: Jaguars kicker Cam Little made a 70-yard field goal that would have been an NFL record had it occurred during the regular season.

title: Lamb, in street garb, trucked by ref, then flagged
content: CeeDee Lamb took a big hit and committed a penalty in the Cowboys' preseason opener -- even though the star receiver wasn't playing.

title: Moore, out all of '24, hurt on first play for Vikings
content: Vikings wide receiver Rondale Moore suffered a "pretty significant" injury to his left knee against the Texans, hurting it on his first play after returning from a major injury last season to his right knee.

title: Jimbo eyes college coaching return: 'Still love it'
content: Jimbo Fisher, who received a record $76 million buyout after he was fired as Texas A&M football coach in 2023, says he wants to return to the sideline.

title: Rivera tears Achilles during Old-Timers' game
content: Mariano Rivera tore an Achilles tendon while going after a fly ball at the Yankees' Old-Timers' Day game and needs surgery.

title: 2 Japanese boxers die after injuries on same card
content: Japanese boxers Shigetoshi Kotari and Hiromasa Urakawa have died following brain injuries sustained while competing on the same card, although in different fights, at Korakuen Hall in Tokyo on Aug. 2.

title: McCarthy emotional in return from injury 'journey'
content: An emotional J.J. McCarthy took the field for a 13-play stint that cemented his return from a yearlong injury absence as the Vikings topped the Texans 20-10 on Saturday.

title: Zilisch breaks collarbone in scary Victory Lane fall
content: NASCAR Xfinity Series points leader Connor Zilisch broke his collarbone after a hard fall in Victory Lane at Watkins Glen International.

title: 🔥 Brewers' Misiorowski pulls rare Pokémon card
content: The Milwaukee Brewers' vibes were high when they pulled a rare Pokémon card after extending their win streak to seven.

title: Online predators prey on young athletes using sextortion
content: A Michigan teen was goaded into sharing an intimate photo that scammers threatened to expose unless he paid up.

title: Do Draft list: Henry, Purdy, Kelce among players being undervalued
content: In the perennial counterpart to the Do Not Draft list, Eric Karabell discusses players who are being underappreciated in fantasy football drafts.

title: 'I want it to be my life': Why Patrick Mahomes is much more than a celebrity product endorser
content: For an active athlete of his stature, the Chiefs QB has been unusually involved in his coffee brand's coast-to-coast growth.

title: Do the Cubs have a championship-level roster? Here's what MLB insiders think
content: After a trade deadline that was more mild than wild, we asked around the sport to see if the Cubs have enough to win big.

title: Transfer rumors, news: Calvert-Lewin fires agent, will push for Man United deal
content: Dominic Calvert-Lewin is doing all he can to sign for Manchester United, and has sacked his agent. Transfer Talk has the latest news, gossip and rumors.

title: 🏈 Ranking all 136 FBS teams ahead of the season
content: From Tier 1 to Tier 20, David Hale ranks all 136 college football program into tiers ahead of the 2025 season.

title: 🏆 Passan's 2025 MLB trade deadline awards
content: Here's what we learned from this year's deals -- and titles for the teams with the most interesting elements of trade season.

title: 🏀 Crypto group says it organized sex toy tosses
content: A self-described cryptocurrency enthusiast told ESPN that the recent sex toy stunts that have disrupted WNBA games were orchestrated by a group he is involved in.

title: 🏈 ESPN acquiring NFL Network, RedZone from NFL
content: ESPN is acquiring the NFL Network and other NFL media assets, including the linear rights to the league's popular RedZone channel, in a deal that will see the NFL get a 10% equity stake in the all-sports network, it was announced.

title: 🧂 49ers' Kittle bemoans NFL's smelling salts ban
content: The NFL is banning the use of smelling salts and ammonia packets before and during all games, a ruling that has upset 49ers TE George Kittle.

title: 👊 Khabib hopes McGregor changes lifestyle
content: Retired mixed martial arts legend Khabib Nurmagomedov said he hopes former rival Conor McGregor changes how he is living or "it will be punishment all his life."

title: Does NFL success and fame translate to college football success? These schools are betting it does
content: With high expectations for this new wave of celebrity coaches that includes Eddie George, reputation can take these leaders only so far.

title: Sesko signs: How Man United won the race and how he'll fit in Amorim's plans
content: Benjamin Sesko has completed his blockbuster move to Man United: How he plays, how he'll fit in Ruben Amorim's plans

title: Can Wrexham's Hollywood fairy tale continue, or is rude awakening ahead?
content: Ryan Reynolds and Rob Mac have their sights on the EPL -- but the closer they get, the more unrealistic it is.

title: How the Indiana Fever adjust to season-ending injuries to Colson, McDonald
content: With Caitlin Clark out, the backcourt was already depleted. How will losing two guards impact the Fever's playoff race?

title: Caitlin Clark and 13 more impact WNBA players for playoff (or future) success
content: The margin for error is shrinking as the playoffs approach. Who will be the difference-makers for their teams?

title: How Jordyn Jackson, Saniyah Hall fit at Maryland, USC
content: Breaking down the fits of every five-star commitment, including No. 1 Saniyah Hall and No. 8 Jordyn Jackson.

title: Texas to Pennsylvania: Can you ace the last 'SportsCenter' 50-in-50 quiz?
content: Close out the "SportsCenter" 50-state road trip with nine questions from the Lone Star State to the Keystone State and several in between.

title: "No Choice But To Finish The Job": Netanyahu On Gaza Takeover Plan
content: Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu says Israel "has no choice but to finish the job and complete the defeat of Hamas."

title: Congress Turns 'Vote Chori' Allegation Into Campaign Ahead Of Bihar Polls
content: The Congress launched its "Vote Chori" (vote theft) campaign today, demanding transparency from the Election Commission in maintaining voter rolls.

title: Girl, 8, Raped And Killed At Tea Garden In Assam, 1 Arrested: Cops
content: An eight-year-old girl was allegedly raped and killed at a tea garden in Assam's Dibrugarh district, police said on Sunday.

title: Italy Shuts Down Mount Vesuvius To Tourists As Wildfire Rages
content: Italian firefighters on Sunday tackled a wildfire on the flanks of Mount Vesuvius, with all hiking routes up the volcano near Naples closed to tourists.

title: UK F-35B Fighter Jet Makes Emergency Landing In Japan, Delays Some Flights
content: A UK Royal Air Force F-35B fighter jet made an emergency landing at Japan's Kagoshima airport after experiencing a mechanical problem mid-air, local media reported.

title: Poll Body Fact-Checks Yet Another Voter Fraud Claim By Rahul Gandhi
content: The Election Commission today fact-checked yet another claim made by Congress leader Rahul Gandhi recently over alleged election manipulation, which has become a flashpoint between him and the poll body.

title: Bhopal Doctor Duped Of Rs 10 Lakh Over Fake Bigg Boss Entry Promise: Cops
content: Dr. Abhineet Gupta from Bhopal was conned out of Rs 10 lakh on the pretext of getting entry in the popular television reality show "Bigg Boss".

title: 3 Boys Go Missing During Weekly Day Out From Shimla's Oldest Boarding School: Cops
content: Three minor students of one of the oldest premier boys boarding schools for boys in Asia, the Bishop Cotton School in Shimla, have gone missing under mysterious circumstances while on a weekly day out in the Himachal Pradesh capital.

title: Air India's B787-8 Fleet Gets New Interiors In $400 Million Revamp
content: Air India has launched an extensive $400 million fleet retrofit programme, the airline announced in a statement today.

title: Firefighters Bring France's Largest Wildfire In Decades Under Control, 1 Dead
content: Firefighters have contained a massive wildfire in southern France. Still, local officials warned that scorching heat and dry conditions could reignite the blaze, as parts of the Mediterranean region face a heatwave.

title: Bengaluru Provided Tech For Op Sindoor: PM On Youth At IT Capital
content: Bengaluru is the symbol of New India and its young people were the ones who provided cutting-edge technology to the Indian Armed Forces, enabling them to bring Pakistan to its knees during Operation Sindoor, Prime Minister Narendra Modi said.

title: Over 600 Pilgrims Hospitalised Due To Chlorine Gas Leak In Iraq
content: More than 600 pilgrims in Iraq were briefly hospitalised with respiratory problems after inhaling chlorine as the result of a leak at a water treatment station.

title: "Screamed In Pain": Maharashtra Woman Dies In Ambulance Stuck In NH 48 Jam
content: A massive traffic jam on a national highway claimed the life of a 49-year-old woman who was being rushed to a Mumbai hospital after a critical injury

title: 2 Elderly Women Found Dead In Kerala House, Missing Brother Prime Suspect
content: Two sisters, who lived together in Kerala's Kozhikode, were found dead under mysterious circumstances in their home.

title: Air India Express Announces 'Freedom Sale', Tickets Start At...
content: Air India Express on Sunday announced a 'freedom sale' to mark India's 79th Independence Day, offering around 50 lakh seats starting from Rs 1,279 across its domestic and international network.

title: CBI Busts Fake Amazon Tech Support Centre Operating In Maharashtra, 5 Arrested
content: The CBI has dismantled a clandestine syndicate of cyber criminals masquerading as Amazon technical support centre operational at a resort in Maharashtra's Nashik, arresting five Mumbai-based fraudsters, officials said.

title: Liquor Home Delivery In Kerala? Beverage Body Floats Proposal
content: The Kerala State Beverages (Marketing & Manufacturing) Corporation Limited (BEVCO) has put forth a proposal to the state government for the home delivery of liquor through online sales.

title: "Sabke Boss Unable To Accept India's Growth": Rajnath Singh's Dig At Trump
content: Defence Minister Rajnath Singh this morning made a scathing critique of the US tariffs, claiming global powers are jealous of India's rapid growth.

title: Cop Father vs Lawyer Daughter Over Constable He Fired For 'Molestation'
content: In a case where familial bonds took a backseat to principles and professionalism, a retired top cop's suspension order for a constable was challenged by his advocate daughter, who eventually triumphed over her father and overturned his directive.

title: UP Woman Calls Lover Home, Joins Husband In Killing Him With Screwdriver
content: Police have arrested a couple in Uttar Pradesh's Sambhal for allegedly torturing and murdering a 35-year-old man at their home with tools such as a screwdriver and pliers

title: Railways issues alert after relief engine collides derailing stranded train in Jharkhand
content: After the accident, Railway Board issued a circular to General Managers of all Zonal Railways to ensure that speed restrictions prescribed in such situations are strictly followed

title: Centre has failed to curb terrorism in Jammu and Kashmir: Pawan Khera
content: Pawan Khera criticises BJP government’s handling of terrorism in Jammu and Kashmir, calling out their empty promises and failures

title: Andhra Pradesh farmers’ unions accuse governments of illegal land grabs
content: They demand strict adherence to the 2013 Land Acquisition Act, fair compensation, and rehabilitation for families displaced by corporate projects

title: Tamil Nadu among States that saw a dip in capex in Q1, FY2026
content: Tamil Nadu’s capital expenditure declined about 18% to ₹4,155.74 crore in April-June 2025 quarter, when compared to ₹5,041.90 crore in the same period last year

title: 3.1 magnitude earthquake strikes Haryana's Jhajjar, no casualties
content: According to the National Centre for Seismology, the quake was recorded at 4:10 p.m. hours with its epicentre 7 km east-northeast (ENE) of Jhajjar

title: Probe report by expert panel flags vulnerable segments along NH 66 in Kerala
content: As per the report submitted to the National Highway Authority of India last week, many slopes and reinforced earth walls built on NH 66 in the State are prone to landslips and cave-in

title: A unique Kalyani Chalukya-era stepwell emerging from obscurity in Gadag
content: The Nagakunda Pushkarani is a stepwell — similar in form and function to the more famous ones like Rani ki Vav or Adalaj in Gujarat — that is poised for revival thanks to the ‘Adopt a Monument’ scheme of the Department of Archaeology, Museums and Heritage

title: Congress to audit voters’ list over 'irregularities' in 2019 Lok Sabha elections, says Venugopal
content: The Congress general secretary said there were 48 constituencies where INDIA bloc candidates lost by fewer than 50,000 votes, and the party would carry out extensive checks in all of them

title: Slide in FIFA chart has a lot to do with complex, fluctuating nature of ranking system: Kalyan Chaubey
content: Indian team drops to 133rd in FIFA rankings, AIFF President explains ranking system complexity and hopes for improvement

title: Shubhanshu Shukla’s ISS experience to prove valuable for Gaganyaan: ISRO chairman V. Narayanan
content: Dr. Narayanan addressed the 13th convocation of the Indian Institute of Space Science and Technology (IIST) in virtual mode on August 10.

title: Over 500 STEM graduates take employability test under Nipun Karnataka programme
content: The initiative launched in Kalaburagi aims to bridge job-readiness gap in Tier-2 and Tier-3 cities in the State

title: Saddening, say academics, as Mumbai’s St. Xavier’s College cancels Stan Swamy memorial lecture after ABVP objection
content: The right-wing students’ organisation raised objection saying that the lecture glorified a person who was accused of committing ‘anti-national conspiracies’. Charges against the tribal rights activist and Jesuit priest were never proved, say academics. He was in state custody when he died in Mumbai in 2021

title: Victorian botany alumni display petals of pride
content: Government Victoria College’s Botany department celebrates platinum jubilee with reunion of former students

title: Shakespeare’s works have influenced Kannada writings, says Vice-Chancellor Kelaginamani
content: The English writer’s plays brought a new wave of excitement to Kannada literature and theatre, he says at lecture series inauguration in Dharwad

title: Nalam Kaakkum Stalin camps in Tiruchi benefit over 4,500 residents
content: The camps offer a wide range of services, including general health screenings, specialist consultations, diagnostic tests, and the distribution of free medicines

title: Stop spreading rumours against Dharmasthala, says MLA
content: The Dharmadhikari is engaged in social service, women’s empowerment and farmers welfare, according to Shivaganga Basavaraj

title: Air India to upgrade avionics, critical components of Dreamliners to reduce operational issues
content: In recent times, the airline has faced operational issues with some of its planes, including the Dreamliner

title: Surfer Ramesh Budihal’s achievement inspires budding surfers, says Kerala Tourism Minister
content: He creates history as the first Indian surfer to qualify for the Open Men’s final at the ASF Asian Surfing Championships 2025

title: State government 'put pressure' on hospital not to admit my wife for treatment: Father of R.G. Kar victim
content: Mother of R.G. Kar victim denied admission to hospital after alleged police assault; hospital officials silent on incident

title: Three Shimla boarding school students who went missing found: Police
content: Parents of the missing children have been informed and a search for the students of the private school is underway, police said

title: Expedite ‘Adavi Thalli Bata’ works to provide road connectivity to remote tribal habitations in Andhra Pradesh, Pawan Kalyan tells officials
content: As many as 625 roads are proposed to be laid under the programme with funds available under MGNREGS and ₹556 crore sanctioned under PM JANMAN, he says

title: Chhattisgarh villager's 'khulja SIM SIM' tryst begets calls from legends like Kohli, de Villiers
content: The story turned on its head when, on July 15, Rajat Patidar himself called up with a fervent "brother, please return my SIM". Manish and Khemraj still believed it was a prank before realising the seriousness in Patidar's tone when he spoke about sending police to solve the matter

title: Botcha ignored North Andhra development while in power, alleges MSME Minister
content: Kondapalli Srinivas accuses YSRCP leaders of deterring investments, highlights Stree Shakti free bus service and welfare schemes as proof of balanced governance

title: Puliyancholai eco-tourism site shut for one day after sloth bear is spotted
content: Local people and field staff of the Forest Department spotted the sloth bear on Saturday evening; eco-tourism site closed for a day as a precautionary measure

title: Retrieved Chola-era Ardhanarisvara sculpture to be on public display at Vriddachalam temple
content: Once embedded in the outer wall of the sanctum sanctorum of Viruddhagireeswarar temple, the sculpture was removed in 2002 after being classified as damaged. A replica was installed in its place for worship.

title: ECI says no objections filed by parties even nine days after Bihar draft rolls release
content: The draft roll will be available till September 1 for claims and objections under which parties and individuals can seek inclusion of eligible citizens left out and exclusion of those they believe are ineligible

title: Karnataka CEO asks Rahul Gandhi to share documents based on which he claimed woman voted twice
content: Karnataka top poll officer told Rahul Gandhi that the documents will help his office carryout a detailed inquiry.

title: K.C. Venugopal alleges voters’ list tampering helped Modi become Prime Minister
content: The Congress will conduct a large-scale audit to detect irregularities in the voters’ list for the 2024 Lok Sabha elections, says Alappuzha MP

title: IISER sets up committee to probe circumstances behind unnatural death of PhD student
content: Anamtira Roy, a life science researcher of the Haringhata campus in Nadia district, died in AIIMS Kalyani hospital on August 8, 2025) morning, hours after falling ill on the campus

title: Rajya Sabha has vacancies from J&K during Vice-Presidential poll for second consecutive time
content: The four seats from the Union Territory are vacant as the Election Commission has so far not held biennial polls to fill up the vacancies nearly 10 months

title: Alappuzha Medical College Hospital launches ‘Half-Birthday’ to boost infant growth
content: Programme aims to assess the growth, development and nutritional needs of babies beyond breastfeeding, focussing on those who have completed six months of age

title: Congress leader Anand Sharma resigns as chairman of party’s foreign affairs department
content: The former Union minister led the department for around a decade as the National Committee of Department of Foreign Affairs was last constituted in 2018

title: Kerala MP Kodikunnil Suresh slams Centre for denying AIIMS to State
content: It is deeply disappointing that Kerala remains one of the few States without an AIIMS. The Centre must end this neglect and include Kerala in the next phase of AIIMS expansion without delay, says MP

title: Tribal sub-plan must be implemented to improve socioeconomic conditions of people living in agency areas: AIKMKS
content: Allocation of funds in the budget should be in accordance with the population of the tribal people since their socio-economic status was very poor compared to other sections of society

title: Indian tech, Make in India behind Operation Sindoor’s success: PM Modi
content: The world for the first time saw the new face of India during Operation Sindoor when it demonstrated its ability in destroying the terror hubs deep inside Pakistan, he said.

title: U.P. cop reinstated by High Court after ex-IG's daughter argues case against father's order
content: Constable Taufiq Ahmad was dismissed on January 13, 2023, following departmental proceedings over allegedly sexually assaulting a woman passenger and offences under the POCSO Act

title: IIT Kharagpur, IIST exploring collaboration in medical technology
content: IIST’s work in mission-class hardware design, start-up incubation and strategic collaborations position India not just as a participant, but as a leader in global space innovation, says Suman Chakraborty

title: CM Siddaramaiah says Karnataka outspending Centre on Bengaluru metro
content: While acknowledging the Centre’s technical and financial assistance, Siddaramaiah noted that much of it comes in the form of loans and equity, which the state must repay with interest

title: EC is shooting the messenger and ignoring the message, says Congress’s Abhishek Singhvi
content: A genuinely responsible constitutional body would have received the detailed representation by the Leader of the Opposition in the world’s largest democracy with concern and receptivity, the Congress Working Committee member said

title: Dalit assault case: TDP leader forecasts Bhumana’s arrest soon
content: TDP spokesperson Kommareddy Pattabhiram said theYSR Congress leaders had forced Mr. Pavan to issue a false statement that the attacker was his cousin brother and that the assault had no political angle

title: Opposition parties satirise Suresh Gopi’s ‘absenteeism’ from his constituency; KSU files missing person complaint
content: General Education Minister and Communist Party of India (Marxist) [CPI(M)] State committee member V. Sivankutty wrote on Facebook: “Posters are appearing in Thrissur for a missing person”

title: Senior Advocates not permitted to mention cases before CJI's Court from August 11
content: On August 6, the CJI had said that from August 11, no Senior Advocate will be permitted to mention cases for urgent listing and hearing in his court so that juniors get an opportunity to do it

title: Election Commission delists 23 registered unrecognised political parties in Tamil Nadu, Puducherry
content: The ECI had, in June, issued notices to 24 registered unrecognised political parties in Tamil Nadu as to why they should not be delisted, since they have not contested any election.

title: Panneerselvam wants Thirumavalavan to withdraw remarks on MGR, Jayalalithaa
content: Mr. Thirumavalavan should think if it was appropriate to criticise Amma (Jayalalithaa) on her caste, the former coordinator of AIADMK said

title: Police detain Ambedkar Okkoota members planning a protest demanding renaming of Bengaluru’s Ragigudda metro station
content: The area where the station has been constructed is situated in Marenahalli and not Ragigudda which is around half a kilometre away from the station.

title: Akhilesh Yadav accuses BJP of 'electoral corruption'
content: Akhilesh Yadav alleged that the BJP, with the connivance of some officials, manipulates voter lists by adding fake voters who support it and deleting names of opposition supporters

title: D.K. Shivakumar says Centre contributing only 20% to Bengaluru Metro Yellow Line
content: Comparing tax allocations, D.K. Shivakumar pointed out that Ahmedabad receives a 20% share, while Bengaluru gets only 10%. “We should be treated like other major cities and considered alongside the national capital,” he said, adding that his appeal was non-political

title: India world’s most ‘dashing and dynamic’ economy, some people not liking it: Rajnath
content: Rajnath Singh’s comments come amid high tariffs announced by US President Donald Trump on goods imported from India

title: Pedestrian killed, another hurt as SUV rams into pavement near Gyarah Murti in Delhi
content: The incident took place when a white Mahindra Thar coming from the direction of central Delhi swerved towards the pavement and struck the two men, police said

title: Priyank Kharge accuses BJP of ‘hijacking’ credit for Yellow Line
content: According to Karnataka Rural Development Minister, after BJP came to power, their commitment to the project dwindled, with the Central Government’s share decreasing drastically in subsequent phases

title: PM Modi inaugurates long-delayed Yellow Line of Bengaluru Metro, flags off Vande Bharat to Belagavi
content: An official said the train carrying PM Modi would be operated by a woman loco pilot; school children will also be on board and Mr. Modi is expected to interact with them, the official said

title: PM Modi to inaugurate newly-constructed flats for MPs in New Delhi
content: The development of the project was necessitated due to shortage of adequate housing for Members of Parliament

title: Police book woman student's ex-boyfriend for her death
content: Pramod Behera was booked after the victim's father lodged a written complaint at the police station on Saturday (August 9, 2025), naming him as the prime accused

title: ‘Drone thieves’ trigger panic, night patrols across villages in western Uttar Pradesh
content: According to police, the roots of this hysteria lie in Amroha, where bizarre rumours began circulating in early June about an underwear-clad, oil-smeared gang of thieves using drones to survey homes before burglaries

title: Watch: Thackeray vs Shinde: Delhi trips, political gambits and party storms
content: Why were Uddhav Thackeray and Eknath Shinde in Delhi this week? How will the possibility of Raj-Uddhav’s alliance affect the INDIA bloc? In this episode of Pulse Maharashtra, we give context to the top news from Maharashtra this week.

title: Bihar Deputy CM Vijay Kumar Sinha has two EPIC numbers, says Tejashwi Yadav
content: Asking the ECI and the district administrations of Patna and Lakhisarai what action would be taken against the BJP leader, the RJD leader pointed to the ECI’s swiftness in issuing a notice to him

title: Farmers in Maharashtra to hoist tricolour in fields on Independence Day to protest Shaktipeeth Expressway
content: Congress MLC Satej Patil said the protest move symbolises farmers’ demand for “freedom” from the project

title: Private bus goes up in flames on NH 966 near Calicut International Airport
content: The incident took place around 9 a.m. between Kolathur and Thurakkal and according to the bus driver, a short circuit likely caused the fire

title: Unhygienic, dirty, stained seat to passenger: Delhi consumer forum tells Indigo Airlines to pay ₹1.5 lakh compensation
content: The New Delhi District Consumer Disputes Redressal Commission was hearing a complaint filed by Pinki, alleging that she was provided an “unhygienic, dirty and stained” seat while she was travelling from Baku to New Delhi on January 2 this year

title: Heard of Laapataa Ladies not of laapataa V-P: Kapil Sibal on Dhankhar's no-show since resignation
content: Sibal urged Union Home Minister Amit Shah to make a statement on the whereabouts of Dhankhar to assuage his concerns about his health and well-being

content: the 2025 preseason kicks off with several rookies playing their first snaps . rookies and offseason acquisitions make the biggest impact in their first game action . the rookies made a big hit and a pass breakup on the first drive .

title: Ultimate Fantasy Football Cheat Sheet: Print. Draft. Win
content: the ultimate ESPN fantasy football cheat sheet is a curated rundown of all the names we've been talking about this preseason . if you want to read more about sleepers, busts, rookies, backups, value picks and more, the analysis is available for you to pore through .

title: How will Yankees manage busy bullpen?
content: the fantasy baseball buzz file aims to provide fantasy managers with the intel they need as news breaks around MLB . the game is the rubber game of the weekend between the St. Louis Cardinals and the Chicago Cubs . a left oblique strain was scratched from today's start and was placed on the 15-day IL with a . left strain .
